pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:0.4: The training rule on supporting a schism
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.2: At that time Devadatta was pursuing schism in the Order, a break in transmission.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.4: “Devadatta doesn’t speak in accordance with the Teaching or the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.5: How can he pursue schism in the Order?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.6: But Kokālika, Kaṭamodakatissaka, Khaṇḍadeviyā-putta, and Samuddadatta said to those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.8: Devadatta does speak in accordance with the Teaching and the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.9: And he speaks with our consent and agreement. He knows about us and speaks for us, and we approve of this.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.10: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.12: “How can these monks support Devadatta’s pursuit of schism in the Order?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.13: They rebuked those monks in many ways and then told the Master. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.14: He said, “Is it true, monks, that some monks support Devadatta’s pursuit of schism in the Order?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.17: Monks, how can those foolish men support Devadatta’s pursuit of schism in the Order?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.18: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.19: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.20: ‘That monk may have one, two, or three monks who side with him and support him, and they may say,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.23: He speaks in accordance with the Teaching and the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.24: And he speaks with our consent and agreement. He knows about us and speaks for us, and we approve of this.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.25: The monks should say to those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.27: this monk does not speak in accordance with the Teaching or the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.28: Don’t consent to schism in the Order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.29: Stay with the Order, for a united Order—in concord, in harmony, having a joint recitation—lives in comfort.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.31: If those monks still continue as before, the monks should press them up to three times to make them stop.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.32: If they then stop, all is well.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:1.33: If not, they commit an offense entailing suspension.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.2: that monk who is pursuing schism in the Order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.6: they have the same view, the same belief, the same preference as he does.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.8: they take his side and are part of his group.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.10: There is one, or two, or three. They may say,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.12: “Venerables, don’t correct this monk. He speaks in accordance with the Teaching and the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.14: And he speaks with our consent and agreement. He knows about us and speaks for us, and we approve of this.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.16: those monks who side with him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.18: Other monks, those who see it or hear about it. They should say,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.21: this monk does not speak in accordance with the Teaching or the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.22: Don’t consent to schism in the Order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.24: for a united Order—in concord, in harmony, having a joint recitation—lives in comfort.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.25: And they should say this a second
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.27: If they stop, all is well.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.28: If they do not stop, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.29: If those who hear about it do not say anything, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.30: Those monks, even if they have to be dragged into the middle of the Order, should be to spoken to thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.32: this monk does not speak in accordance with the Teaching or the training.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.33: Don’t consent to schism in the Order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.35: for a united Order—in concord, in harmony, having a joint recitation—lives in comfort.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.36: They should say this a second
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.38: If they stop, all is well.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.39: If they do not stop, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.41: “And, monks, they should be pressed in this way.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.42: A competent and capable monk should inform the Order:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.43: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Order to listen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.44: Monks so-and-so and so-and-so are siding with him and supporting monk so-and-so who is pursuing schism in the Order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.45: They are not stopping that activity.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.46: If it seems appropriate to the Order, the Order should press them to make them stop.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.48: Please, Venerables, I ask the Order to listen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.49: Monks so-and-so and so-and-so are siding with and supporting monk so-and-so who is pursuing schism in the Order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.50: They are not stopping that activity.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.51: The Order presses them to make them stop.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.52: Any monk who approves of pressing them to make them stop should remain silent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.53: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.55: For the third time I speak on this matter:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.56: Please, Venerables, I ask the Order to listen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.57: Monks so-and-so and so-and-so are siding with and supporting monk so-and-so who is pursuing schism in the Order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.58: They are not stopping that activity.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.59: The Order presses them to make them stop.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.60: Any monk who approves of pressing them to make them stop should remain silent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.61: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.62: The monks so-and-so and so-and-so have been pressed by the Order to make them stop that activity.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.63: The Order approves and is therefore silent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.65: After the motion, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.66: After each of the first two announcements, they commit a serious offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.67: When the last announcement is finished, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.68: For those who commit the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.69: Two or three can be pressed together, but not more than that.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.70: They commit an offense entailing suspension:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:2.71: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.1: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and they perceive it as legitimate, but they do not stop, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.2: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but they are unsure if it is, and they do not stop, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.3: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but they perceive it as illegitimate, and they do not stop, they commit an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.4: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they perceive it as legitimate, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.5: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they are unsure if it is, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.1.6: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and they perceive it as illegitimate, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.2.2: if they have not been pressed;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.2.6: if they are overwhelmed by pain;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.2.7: if they are the first offenders.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss11:3.2.8: The eleventh rule, the training rule on supporting a schism, is finished.
